forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 4pm. Mostly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. West wind 13 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 45. Northwest wind 3 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
As the day unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, the air is thick with the promise of rain which lingers until late afternoon. Currently, the skies are draped in a gauzy shroud, casting a muted light across the cityscape. The chill, hovering around 58 degrees, penetrates easily through the dampness in the air, suggesting that a cozy layer would be prudent—think a light jacket or a warm sweater paired with a sturdy pair of shoes to contend with any occasional sprinkles that might fall. 

By tonight, the clouds will shift ever so slightly, offering a glimpse of stars against a backdrop of partly cloudy skies as temperatures dip to around 45 degrees. The breeze from the northwest, light yet refreshingly crisp, will invite evening strolls or the simple pleasure of a warm drink in a favorite armchair. It's a day where one might relish the idea of flipping through pages of a good book or enjoying a quiet moment in a local café, as the world outside softens in the gentle embrace of the impending night.
